questions.question: What is the 'skin effect' in electrical conductors?
options: The tendency of alternating current to flow only on the surface of a conductor
The tendency of direct current to flow only in the core of a conductor
The phenomenon where the outer layer of a conductor has a higher resistance
The phenomenon where the inner layer of a conductor has a lower inductance
questions.correct_answer: The tendency of alternating current to flow only on the surface of a conductor

questions.question: Which modulation technique uses a carrier wave whose phase is changed in accordance with the input signal?
In a Bode plot, what does a negative slope indicate?
What is the principle of superposition as applied to electrical circuits?
options: The total current in a circuit is equal to the sum of the currents through each component
The total voltage in a circuit is equal to the sum of the voltages across each component
The response in a linear, passive circuit with multiple independent sources can be calculated as the sum of the responses of each source acting independently
The power consumed in a circuit is equal to the sum of the power consumed by each component
questions.correct_answer: The response in a linear, passive circuit with multiple independent sources can be calculated as the sum of the responses of each source acting independently

questions.question: What type of oscillator uses a parallel LC circuit (tank circuit) to provide the oscillations?
In control systems, what is the purpose of a PID controller?
options: To provide feedback control using proportional, integral, and derivative terms
To control the power supplied to the system
To generate a signal based on a set of predefined instructions
questions.correct_answer: To provide feedback control using proportional, integral, and derivative terms

questions.question: In digital logic, what type of flip-flop output depends not only on the current input state but also the previous input state?
In power electronics, what type of device is a thyristor?
options: A device that can be turned on by a gate signal, but can only be turned off when the current drops to zero
A device that can be turned on and off by a gate signal
A device that can amplify the power of an input signal
A device that converts DC to AC
questions.correct_answer: A device that can be turned on by a gate signal, but can only be turned off when the current drops to zero

questions.question: What is the process of converting a continuous time signal into a discrete time signal called?
What does the Nyquist-Shannon sampling theorem state?
options: A signal must be sampled at twice its highest frequency to avoid aliasing
A signal must be sampled at half its highest frequency to avoid aliasing
A signal can be sampled at any frequency above its highest frequency
A signal can be perfectly reconstructed from its samples if the sampling frequency is greater than twice the highest frequency of the signal
questions.correct_answer: A signal can be perfectly reconstructed from its samples if the sampling frequency is greater than twice the highest frequency of the signal
